content: @Rob Hausam / @Grahame Grieve from https://tx.fhir.org/snomed/ it seems that International, Australia and US is supported - what would it take to get other national editions on that server?
asking, and helping one of us get a license from the NRO
also ca is loaded

What's NRO? @Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg - do you know someone? @Grahame Grieve more specifically, I would like to have the danish one added to the list. The danish edition url is http://snomed.info/sct/554471000005108
National Release Office
k - I'm on it

@Jens Villadsen We've already made some progress on the Danish edition. You might not need to do anything now, actually. Let me check and I'll let you know - probably in a few minutes - and we should be able to get it loaded.

@Jens Villadsen I had worked with @Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg on it in August, and we were able to work it out so that I have access to the Danish extension via MLDS. We ran into a delay at that time, so it hasn't yet been loaded. But I've now downloaded the Sept. 2021 Danish extension release, and I'll see if I can get it loaded on tx.fhir.org today.
@Jens Villadsen I've run into an import issue with several of the extensions (not only the Danish). Once I get that sorted out I should be able to get it uploaded.
@Rob Hausam let me know when you're ready ;)

The Danish and Belgian SNOMED CT extensions are now loaded on tx.fhir.org! I'm also working on loading the Swedish extension, but still have a glitch to work out on that. And a license request for the Netherlands extension is pending in MLDS. @Jens Villadsen @Daniel Karlsson @Jose Costa Teixeira @David Simons
Please verify the non-English terms (and any other uniquenesses that you may be aware of in these editions), and let us know if you find any problems with the import.
The Swedish extension is also now loaded. @Daniel Karlsson
@Rob Hausam There's a (long standing) issue with the Canadian edition that all the letter b's disappear on http://tx.fhir.org/snomed/20611000087101-20210331.
@Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg FYI
Thx @Rob Hausam
Excellent, thanks @Rob Hausam Will try to build some Swedish IGs today and let you know the outcome.
Works, including expansion of extension refsets: https://build.fhir.org/ig/danka74/basprofiler-r4/ValueSet-SEBaseSKRYrkeVS.html

@Rob Hausam I should be able to address the danish snomed like the following snippet (within a valueset):

        "system": "http://snomed.info/sct",
        "version": "http://snomed.info/sct/554471000005108",
        "concept": [

right, @Rob Hausam ?
yes that's right
@Elliot Silver wow. That's some of the cleverest programming I've ever pulled off!

@Rob Hausam - hmmm .... something is a bit buggy (I know @Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg is also chasing this bug). Some of the concepts cannot be validated (seen in the log https://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7dk/dk-core/branches/1.1.0/qa.html#). Ie. the concept id 550621000005101 cannot found on the tx-server but I can find it browsing https://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=550621000005101&edition=MAIN/SNOMEDCT-DK/2021-09-30&release=&languages=da,en

@Jens Villadsen @Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg Yes, I'm seeing the same problem. For whatever reason, the import doesn't seem to have picked up the additional Danish content (at least I don't see the Danish descriptions). I am getting Belgian and Swedish descriptions with those two extensions, and I'm not sure of anything different that would have caused a problem particularly for the Danish extension. I should probably try doing that import again with a fresh copy of the source and double checking the import settings, and we can see if we can get a better result. It may be a bit later today before I'm able to try that.
@Elliot Silver I assume that your issue with missing 'b's is specific to the html rendering? I don't see that when I query the server directly.

Just to confirm, this:

...
"compose" : {
    "include" : [
      {
        "system" : "http://snomed.info/sct",
        "version" : "http://snomed.info/sct/45991000052106",
        "filter" : [
          {
            "property" : "concept",
            "op" : "in",
            "value" : "67031000052107"
          }
        ]
      },
     ...

works fine and expands just the right refset including extension concepts, somtimes FSN, sometimes PT.

image.png

Also, this:

https://tx.fhir.org/r4/CodeSystem/$lookup?system=http://snomed.info/sct&version=http://snomed.info/sct/45991000052106&code=223366009

works and provides designations in Swedish with the characters just right. However, the designation.language is not provided.

Thanks,
Daniel
@Rob Hausam It is in the HTML rendering. I haven't checked the query results.

However, the designation.language is not provided

Fixed next time I upgrade the server

There's a (long standing) issue with the Canadian edition that all the letter b's disappear on

And the code was specifically removing 'b' from the description in all snomed versions. WTF? And it's sufficiently old that I can't trace it in git easily, and I have no memory of any reason why I would write code like that at all.
anyway, fixed next update
@Elliot Silver Yes. As I noted, I did a spot check on the query results, and that looked ok. But if you see anything there we definitely need to know about it.

It's a bit better now I think @Rob Hausam but its still not picture perfect. I still see warnings on https://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7dk/dk-core/branches/1.1.0/qa.html#_scratch_ig-build-temp-XUXUNS_repo_input_resources_sor-organization-type and the links for the codes on https://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7dk/dk-core/branches/1.1.0/ValueSet-sor-organization-type.html for the danish extension codes does not point to the danish edition on SNOMED ( this should have been added as part of the ULR &edition=MAIN/SNOMEDCT-DK/2021-09-30&release=&languages=da,en - @Grahame Grieve is that a template thing?) but instead points to the international version. The part about the links also goes for the swedish edition (@Daniel Karlsson - eg. this link http://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=68081000052105 should have been https://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=68081000052105&edition=MAIN/SNOMEDCT-SE/2021-05-31&release=&languages=sv,en instead on https://build.fhir.org/ig/danka74/basprofiler-r4/ValueSet-SEBaseSKRYrkeVS.html).

Jens Villadsen said:

The part about the links also goes for the swedish edition (Daniel Karlsson - eg. this link http://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=68081000052105 should have been https://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?perspective=full&conceptId1=68081000052105&edition=MAIN/SNOMEDCT-SE/2021-05-31&release=&languages=sv,en instead on https://build.fhir.org/ig/danka74/basprofiler-r4/ValueSet-SEBaseSKRYrkeVS.html).

even better, the links should be http://snomed.info/id/<the SCTID> and then SNOMED International will redirect to the correct browser extension URL (browser if Accept is text/html).

I've worked further on the extension imports generally (including but not limited to the Danish edition). In making the code more correct and robust for the underlying SNOMED concepts themselves, that's apparently uncovered another issue that is now surfacing later in the process in the handling of importing and managing the relationships. So I will continue to look at that and get it sorted out, but that is probably going to take me a little longer to complete (still hopefully soon).
@Daniel Karlsson - if I also know the version as well as the sctId, should I still use http://snomed.info/id/<id> ?
also, http://snomed.info/id/ only works with an id. Still have to reference the tools directly if you don't have an id
@Rob Hausam is there anything I should look at?

@Grahame Grieve Yes, I'm sure that there are things for you to look at. They're not so easy to document and have you reproduce, though (yet). I'm working on further code updates but haven't submitted PR(s) for them yet - but I will soon. You may have to do the imports and see where it's failing. I've worked through some further issues with the loading of the concepts, and the main issue(s) that I'm tracking down now are happening in the cross-relationship processing - I'm seeing those issues in ftx_sct_importer SaveConceptLinks, where I'm getting "no roots found" errors. I have only seen that in the latest work that I've been doing on importing the extension releases "on top" of the specified International edition. I've never seen that in importing an edition directly. At the point in the process that these errors are occurring, the import tool is using > 100 GB RAM on my Windows 10 VM (and that isn't maxed out, so it's not due to an "out of memory" issue).

Grahame Grieve said:

Daniel Karlsson - if I also know the version as well as the sctId, should I still use http://snomed.info/id/<id> ?

I do not think that the browser allows for displaying previous versions (e.g. January 2020). So only for non-version components. I did run the edition and version specific URI through Postman and it seems those have not been implemented.
https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/DOCURI/2.3+Edition+and+Version-Relative+Component+URIs

curl -X GET \
  http://snomed.info/sct/32506021000036107/version/20160930/id/2771000032106 \
  -H 'accept: application/fhir+json'

gives a 404.

no they haven't been. I have an edition and possibly an edition in scope, and I can refer to them directly on the ihtsdo browser, but not via snomed.info/sct. @Peter Williams does snomed have an opinion on what I should do here? Obviously, a redirect via snomed.info/id is more maintainable, but it doesn't currently have the functionality users are expecting

If it's only the edition (e.g. AU edition) and not the version (e.g. Jan 2020) then SNOMED will do the lookup of the an edition

curl -X GET \
  http://snomed.info/id/2771000032106 \
  -H 'accept: application/fhir+json'

so it would be less of an issue. But still, if the same concept appears in multiple editions I don't know which is returned or if it is well defined, so still specifying the edition is likely a requirement.
but I have both: an edition and a concept id

curl http://snomed.info/sct/32506021000036107/id/2771000032106 -H 'accept: application/fhir+json'

gives the 5-step briefing :(
So, SNOMED Int implementing version and edition-relative component redirects should be put on the Christmas list. Will mention this discussion on the next SNOMED on FHIR meeting.
btw, at least for HL7 published IGs (on hl7.org, and fhir.org) I can retrospectively fix links to snomed for concepts once the patterns are clearly defined

The spec here https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/x/vgTJAQ is quite clear - there are Edition-relative and Version-relative forms of the SNOMED component http://snomed.info/id/... URIs. It's up to SNOMED International to deal with resolving them (or not).
none of the samples on that site directs to a proper site at ihtsdotools

There is no requirement for them to resolve at all, or for them to resolve to precise or more general -- they are Identifiers not Locations.
https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/DOCURI/3.1+Resolving+SNOMED+CT+URIs

However, given that the shorter unversioned forms resolve to the browser, it would seem like a useful thing for such resolution to be more consistently supported.
@Peter Williams

I've loaded an updated version of the Danish extension (it should work this time!) and now also the Netherlands Edition on tx.fhir.org. @Jens Villadsen @Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg @David Simons @Alexander Henket

Yes SNOMED International have plans to implement version and edition specific URI resolution (actually @Daniel Karlsson you raised BROWSE-429 specifically for this) and that ticket has been assigned in my current sprint, so, watch this space :smile: @Michael Lawley @Grahame Grieve @Jens Villadsen
@Peter Williams how long are your springs aka. when can we expect it to be generally available?
@Jens Villadsen If it makes the cut, we'll deploy to production on 1 December. Otherwise the next push to production is 19 January.
Looks like it works ;) @Peter Williams
Jens Villadsen has marked this topic as resolved.
